thread.title: Oscars 2017: La La Land WRONGLY named Best Picture after DISASTROUS mix-up with Moonlight
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: La La Land WRONGLY named Best Picture after DISASTROUS mix-up with Moonlight

title: Oscars 2017: La La Land WRONGLY named Best Picture after DISASTROUS mix-up with Moonlight
text:
Oscars 2017: La La Land WRONGLY named Best Picture after DISASTROUS mix-up with Moonlight Oscars 2017: La La Land WRONGLY named Best Picture after DISASTROUS mix-up with Moonlight LA LA LAND was wrongly awarded the gong for Best Picture instead of Moonlight in a disastrous mix-up at the end of today’s 89th Academy Awards. PUBLISHED: 05:19, Mon, Feb 27, 2017 | UPDATED: 05:45, Mon, Feb 27, 2017 
The cast and filmmakers from the movie rushed to the stage to accept the prestigious award after Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway announced them as the winner of the prestigious category. 
After many of the producers said their thank you speeches after scooping the biggest honour of the night, it was announced there had been a major error. 
Someone who appeared to be a producer of the show took to the stage and told the audience: “No there has been a mistake. Moonlight you guys won Best Picture." 
As the audience gasped in horror at the terrible mistake, he continued: “This is not a joke.” ABC Moonlight were announced winner of Best Picture after a disastrous blunder Related articles Oscars 2017: Michael J Fox returns in Back to the Future Delorean 
The card from the envelope was then held up to the screen to confirm the winner of the award. 
The shocking mishap resulted in viewers taking to Twitter to express their utter disbelief at the heart-stopping moment. 
“That is the most awkward thing I have ever saw. I do want to see moonlight though when it is available to rent. #Oscars,” commented one user. 
Another wrote: “What the hell! Seriously, this s**t again! Read and get the winners right! #Oscars #Oscars2017 #Moonlight #LALALAND.” 
“At least LA LA LAND can put 'Best Picture (for a minute)' on the DVD box cover. #Oscars,” a third added. 
One shocked viewer went on: “Whoa! What. On. Earff. #Oscars.” Oscars 2017: Inside the Academy Award Show Mon, February 27, 2017
